greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1; for n > 1, if n = Product prime(k)^e(k), then a(n) = Product (k)^(e(k)-1).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
mathematica: Table[If[n == 1, 1, Apply[Times, Map[PrimePi[#1]^#2 & @@ # &, #]] / Apply[Times, PrimePi[#[[All, 1]] ]]] &@ FactorInteger@ n, {n, 120}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Aug 14 2017 *)
xref: Differs from A290104 for the first time at n=21.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 13 2017
